Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Tallinthe
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights, nice big room. Normally stay near Paddington or Kensington, but the hotels are more expensive with smaller rooms. Had a minor issue with the electricity circuit breaker tripping for the room, this was sorted within 5mins!! The location of Beat western, Swiss Cottage is perfect, it's only a ten minute tube ride to the main attractions. I'll be back !

Reviews.Title: “All you need in a comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Murray51east
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel,stayed here in January.The place is very close to the main road and tube station but very quiet.I loved the high ceilings in my room and the modern bathroom.The young blokes at reception and the breakfast waitresses were very friendly and helpful.Breakfast was ok but we realised there were plenty of cafes on the main street if you did'nt want to pay 8 quid. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: paula h
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending four nights there with my 15 year old daughter and we enjoyed every minute. The hotel is easy to find, beautifully decorated and very comfortable. The continental breakfast was very generous and the tea and coffee making facilities were always well stocked. There was even a laundry service on offer. The staff are friendly and helpful and the area handy for the tube and bus service. There are plenty of places to eat in the evening, we recommend the Chinese place in the high st. The only negative I can think of is that the rooms were a bit too warm and the floor boards squeaky but it certainly didnt spoil my time there! I would definitely return and recommend it to all my friends and family. See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “50th b/day weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Atari
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Very cold weekend but hotel very warm. Has tea/coffee making. Very clean. Booked hotel with cont. breakfast which was very good, polite staff. Easy reach to tube station and swiss cottage town where you will find a Walkabout and W/spoons pubs, restaurants, shops theater and imax. Checked out 1100 train leaving 1800 the hotel even stored luggage while we went back into London central.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend this place”
Reviews.Author: Genevieve C
Reviews.Content: Staff ok - but blah. Rooms tired, Noisy - Creaky floors Musty smells. Poor Value - Would try the Holiday Inn Express next time.

Reviews.Title: “how do they manage to give so much for such reasonable price?”
Reviews.Author: viseuldesus
Reviews.Content: Every room is different. You don't get the feeling of being in a beehive like in modern hotels. This one truely makes you feel as if you are at home in a grand Victorian house. The staff are ALL exceptionally polite and helpful. It is so central and yet so quiet and it is impecably clean. They must have just replaced all the carpets as these are spotless. No unpleasant smells or stains on furniture. Truely a find and so reasonably priced. I heartily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Anna T
Reviews.Content: I was particualy worried about stay at this hotel having read the reviews but myself and my partner thoroughly enjoyed our stay and could not find fault. The staff were very attentive, the room was clean and spacious and the hotel itself is in an excellent location. We will return with pleasure, thank you for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “A little tired!”
Reviews.Author: TYRONE-7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Staff very pleasant on arrival. Room a little tired. We had difficulty with the shower but the staff reacted immediately and we changed rooms. We had breakfast and it was very good value. Quality was good and served by pleasant staff. Location was good for our needs. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: millie m
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week with my husband and a 4-year-old daughter. We thoroughly enjoyed out time there. We booked a family room and were given a suite of two bedrooms - very useful with a child. The location is perfect (right next to the underground, close to shops and buses, yet very quiet and residential) and the hotel was itself quite charming. The room was spacious, nicely furnished, clean and warm. The lounge downstairs was lovely. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Room 15”
Reviews.Author: SallySand
Reviews.Content: No-one at the hotel bothered to ask me if I had enjoyed my stay, so I am giving my feedback here instead. I stayed one night in Room 15, a single room. It is a long narrow room, described by front of house chap as a "garden" room but most people would call it a basement room, accessed by climbing through a small door under the stairs. The mattress was so old that all the springs were sticking out, so your sleep will be disturbed all night unless you have very thick skin. The shower control was very stiff, the towel rail fell off and the lamp on the desk console needs fixing. There were good points to my stay: it was very quiet (although there was no-one staying next door, so I was lucky) and a nice safe location; the room was quite clean; the complimentary items were good. I did not buy breakfast as the hotel is very close to some lovely cafes where you can buy breakfast much cheaper and get service with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “a bit traditional english, can be good value”
Reviews.Author: canuckfan491
Reviews.Content: The location, next to Swiss Cottage tube station, is excellent. You are close to the 02 centre, good restaurants on England's Lane and some good Indian and Chinese north on Finchley Road (which is very busy). The hotel is not purpose built, and interesting if you want to experience a more traditional English-type hotel from years ago. The rooms are quite large, and you get a wide range of TV/radion channels via Sky. I would not take the breakfast, as there are better options within short walking distance, or if you want to go over to Hampstead. That said, this hotel is a great value option if you can get it for about 85 pounds a day. For 100 pounds (or thereabout) I would look for other options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Never again and will suggest to work to leave this place alone.”
Reviews.Author: kerry c
Reviews.Content: Will keep this to the facts. Arrived at 1500 on a Friday with no where to park, had to leave th ecar running outside on double yellows to go and ask where the car park is to be met by some funny looks and finally someone acknowledging me to ask what I wanted. 'I was hoping to check in and to park please' I said to receive a comment of you can't leave the car there you will get a ticket and sorry our car park is full, turn around, turn left down the road, across the traffic lights and follow the slip road left and turn left into the Marriot, its a NCP car park at Â£27.50 a day!! I was asked for my card for a swipe, no payment and told I was staying for 1 night. I said no I am staying 2 nights and the man said ok we can sort that tomorrow and asked for my pin. I asked why he needed my pin and he said because the money will come out first thing in the morning for tonights stay. Right fine, and we will do the same thing tomorrow for Sunday. What? anyway next I was told breakfast was from 0800. I explained my company had booked the hotel saying I had to be 2miles for 0800 and was told breakfast would be fine, so I asked if it was just cereals. I was told no sorry you have paid and it starts at 0800, we cannot help. By this point I wasn't greatly pleased as then I had to drive my car to a much nicer hotel around the corner and walk 10mins back to this one. Returned abck with all my luggage and went upstairs to my room. Well the lift could hold me and my 1 bag and suit bag and smelled of dust. I got upstairs to the smallest corridors and oldest, upkept looking polace I had ever been to. My room was about 2metres squared with a small single bed, random frames on the wall that had not been dusted, a mirror that haasn't been cleaned, there was tea and milk with a pack of biscuits and a kettle with an old wooden cheap basket of freshening wood which didn't smell at all. Cigarette burns in the carpet, no coat hook ands no feedback questionnaire. Into the bathroom where the shower curtain was moulding, you couldn't sit on the toilet as the wall was 3 inches from the seat, no face cloth or towel, dirty sink, 20+ cracked tiles wih a shelf falling off the wall. On the upp side the toilet tissue was nice and there was a floor mat which seemed clean. I stay in a lot of hotels and am pretty versatile to what I expect but If the Marriot had room no matter if it was double the cost, I would of moved. Such a shame as this place is giving Best Western a bad name! They are normally quite nice, the other best westerns I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Wait To Get Out!”
Reviews.Author: Genevieve C
Reviews.Content: on says : Like everyone else, I stayed here because of the close proximity to the Swiss Cottage Underground. This is not a Classy Character Hotel by Best Western. Itâ€™s an overpriced D-U-M-P! I think they believe that they are shabby chic or something. Old, dirty, and mismanaged does not qualify as shabby chic cool. The guy, who checked me in, was rude & indifferent. Got the feeling staff morale is low there. Nobody behind that counter looks happy! He handed me a card key and sent me down a cramped stained hallway into a room that was beyond ridiculous. There was an elevator but being 6 feet tall I wouldn't have been able to stand properly! The walls were dirty and the room was not cleaned properly. I had the worst sleep ever as the people above me decided to show up at 1.00 am and walk around or exercise for an hour or two. Almost checked out in the night. I couldnâ€™t wait to get the heck out of there. If you stay here youâ€™re crazy!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience ! Poor Value !”
Reviews.Author: rustneversleeps83
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were scattered around North London for a reunion get together. I was extremely disappointed with this hotel - especially because I got to see my friends hotels and was able to make a comparison. The room was off a tiny corridor and I could hear the neighbours next door. The bathroom barely had room to turn around in it . Was awoken early in the morning by the cleaning staff and doors being opened and closed. Did not find the reception very helpful or friendly. Pricey and poor value! Oh, and no breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't swing a Fly”
Reviews.Author: kenbpfell
Reviews.Content: The room was the smallest in over 40 years of staying in hotels - 8 ft wide. The TV was colour - green and purple only. Morgues have more atmosphere. Positives - close to tube, close to restaurants, quiet - well it would be the place if dead. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “great position very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: barry w
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the hotel. I stayed in a ground floor twin with my teenage daughter. The room was clean,warm and very spacious. The staff were very helpfull at all times. The location was first class, very quiet but a stones throw from local shops and just three stops on the Tube from Piccadilly & Leicester Sq. Definitely a recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: wirralbret
Reviews.Content: Hotel was local to where I was working, room was quiet with a comfy bed and best of all; free internet access, unlike some other hotel chains.... The only downside was the room was a little small and they did not serve evening meals

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for London”
Reviews.Author: Teamscoop
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spacious and well appointed situated in a quiet road in swiss Cottage. Tube (Jubilee Line) is 5 mins walk and is a fast link to central London (on same line as Waterloo if you're coming in from the South). Rooms are clean and well equipped. Breakfast is OK, reasonable (half) English. Outside congestion zone with some car parking (first come first served). We've stayed half a dozen times and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “When I go back to London I will stay here”
Reviews.Author: mariannek18360
Reviews.Content: This place has a delightful atmosphere an ambiance about it and the price is right. The staff was always helpful and always available. I can't say enough about the location which is a 1/2 block from the tube and a few blocks from the bus stops....extremely convenient. The hotel looks like one of the homes nestled in a London neighborhood which made me "feel at home." This area of northern London is away from the crowds of central London, yet if you hop on the tube you are minutes away from the hub-bub of it all. The rooms were not tiny which may be expected when staying in London, rather our room with one queen bed was of comfortable size.The lift is small and goes only to the third floor so if you do not like stairs, then make sure you do not get a room on the 4th floor like we had. Oh...and very important...our room was very clean!!! All in all a very nice stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “UGH STAY AWAY- Best Western - Not here - Worst Western”
Reviews.Author: eaglespirit77
Reviews.Content: An overpriced Dump!!! Don't fall for the deceptive entrance and lounge! This is a rabbit warren of little rooms with no circulation or ventilation. Although defined as N/S - there are smokers and the bacon and cooking smells woft all the way upstairs............. Noise envelopes you everywhere. Reception and managers are apathetic and unobliging. - As a previous tripadvisor wrote. They grunt! IF this were a Best Western in the US, everything would be different. Service, cheerful staff, etc.......but it is not. It is a dump. Creaky floors, old doors that rattle and shake the entire floor. The bathrooms are so tiny that even a child would have a difficult time. There are several places in the neighbourhood that are competitive and not priced at 85 pounds per night - without breakfast. I booked for several days but will be moving out tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HSchuttenberg
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at 10:30 pm to find they had mistakenly reserved our rooms for the next day, and that the hotel was completely full. The receptionist was slow to propose an alternative arrangement, and his main concern was that whatever hotel we booked into wasn't too expensive since Best Western would need to cover the cost if the booking error was their fault. Indeed, a review of correspondence confirmed the hotel was in error, yet we never received an apology for this significant inconvenience. Instead, when we returned to the hotel the next night for the remainder of our stay, we were given a double bed (we had requested a King) in a room with no temperature control and very poor water pressure. The elevator was broken the duration of our 3 day stay, and our experience of the staff continued to be one sorely lacking in a care for customer well-being. I strongly suggest against staying at this poorly managed hotel; my trust in Best Western as a brand has been tested by our experience.

Reviews.Title: “OK Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: R1Stryker
Reviews.Content: For all intensive purposes this hotel suited us just fine. If your just looking to stay the night and get some rest it'll work. Only complaint is the trickling shower with no pressure what so ever. Would not rate it anything higher than 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine if a touch old-fashioned”
Reviews.Author: prof_crunch
Reviews.Content: By the standards of big chain hotels, there's something quaint about this place. Sure, it's got plenty of rooms but its poky reception area, labyrinthine layout and somewhat retro decor make it feel rather old-fashioned. So it's not much good if you're after boutique chic but, for our purposes - somewhere that was walking distance to the Camden Roundhouse (it's about 15 minutes on foot) and close to a tube station (Swiss Cottage is just over the road) - it was just the job. Check-in was efficient although reaching our room less so - the lift was broken and it's not the easiest place to navigate. Our accommodation, once we finally found it, was fine. The room was fairly spacious and had space for a small desk and chair along with a separate armchair in the opposite corner. The bathroom, too, was perfectly adequate - no bath but a decent walk-in shower, and plenty of miniature toiletries. It's not going to win any design awards and, at the price (Â£125 for a twin room on a Saturday night, not including breakfast), it wasn't exactly a bargain. But it was comfortable and suited our needs - I would be happy to return if I could book a room at a cheaper rate.

Reviews.Title: “Bog Standard”
Reviews.Author: n1csome1
Reviews.Content: I have very little to say about this hotel. It wasn't the cheapest hotel we could've found but suited us location-wise for what we were doing that evening. The room was reasonably large for a London hotel however the bathroom was minute with a barely functioning shower which I ended up not even using, opting to wait until i got home. The service was impersonal and automatic, with barely a smile from any of the staff we encountered. Breakfast was very basic, although what we had was good.

Reviews.Title: “A "no frills" hotel in a convenient location at a reasonable price...”
Reviews.Author: ANMW
Reviews.Content: Like many of you, I am sure, I rely heavily on the reviews of guests before deciding whether a hotel is for me. Reading the several reviews posted here, it was hard to know whether to give this hotel a go. Opinions are mixed. So -- let me try to help the next undecided traveler whether to make a booking. The Best Western Swiss Cottage is a no-nonsense hotel. Its rooms are very simple. The furniture, fixtures and fittings have seen better days and the decor is tired. But manage your expectations and you'll notice that the staff are aimiable, the rooms and bathrooms are clean, the hotel is in a quiet location, it's a very short walk to the tube station and nearby local restaurants (Chinese, Indian, Thai, for example), there are some welcome "freebies" (coffee/tea and biscuits in the room, free internet, etc.) and the rack rate for a single adult ranges from GBP 70 to GBP 135 (as of June 2011), depending on the room. In its class, in London, with these features and amenities, it's a reasonable deal. The key is to manage your expectations. This is very much a "no frills" hotel experience, but it delivers on the basics. If you're the type who looks for faults, especially by comparison to other hotels, then don't come here -- you're bound to find something you don't like. But if you can recognize reasonable value when you see it, then you may even be pleasantly surprised by this hotel. A final word. The reception staff have received their fair share of criticism in this forum. That was not my experience. In fact, the Best Western central reservation service made an error in my booking, setting me up for a single room whereas I had booked a double (and had the confirmation slip to prove it). Even though my stay coincided with a busy period for the hotel (Chelsea Flower Show, UEFA final and bank holiday week-end), the reception staff side-stepped the problem by offering me a room upgrade at no extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good breakfast but more effort needed!!”
Reviews.Author: ROCKY58
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - just metres from Swiss Cottage tube station. Te room was clean and the bed comfortable. The breakfast was good too. The hotel though is extremely tatty and in need of an upgrade. Our room had a broken table and there were bare wires showing in the chandelier. We were on the third floor and the lift was broken. Breakfast was served in the restaurant down winding stairs into the basement - not good for elderly guests. The room was expensive - almost Â£185 for one night - and extra for breakfast (however it was a bank holiday weekend). The worst thing about this hotel though was the staff. They were not rude - civil but not friendly. They made us feel as if we ought to thank them for allowing us to stay there! A smile and a bit of conversation goes a long way. We would not stay here again unless the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Lets leave this sort of hotel in the past”
Reviews.Author: balearicrazy
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm been unfair, but I could not wait to get out of this hotel and I was only there for a few hours. Its all the Ds - dated, dank, dark, depressing and damp! Checked in, admittedly quite late (10pm), while efficient, guy on reception gave me a grunt of a hello. Room was a superior double down some very narrow and steep stairs and was right next to the breakfast room. Room smelt damp. Could not open windows, no air con or fan. While large, sparsely decorated with old worn chair and sofa in dark felt green, weird picture of a man starring on the wall, tiny desk (in large room!). Bed, hard, uncomfortable in very small separate room. Bathroom was fine and was clean. Internet access was available and was free, as with all the Best Westerns now. Internet speed was reasonably good. Breakfast - option of cooked for Â£1 - but I could not wait to leave the breakfast room either, very smelly, they obviously have a damp problem unfortunately and not a nice environment to eat breakfast. Stayed here because I'm a Best Western card holder - wish I stayed at the Moystn Hotel (also BW) were I normally stay which is excellent. Good access to the tube, and in a nice area of London as well with good eating out opportunities. So some redeeming factors. Not the worst hotel in the world, but for the rates been charged there is a lot better and a lot better in London within the Best Western group.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: PWD40
Reviews.Content: Having been invited to a wedding at London Zoo, we were recommended to stay at this hotel by the Bride and Groom. We looked at the website, which looked fine, but then we read one or two reviews, which to be honest made us rather apprehensive. How wrong we were to be worried. The hotel is located minutes from Swiss Cottage underground station and is in a charming location. The people behind the reception were friendly and helpful, and the room was clean, spacious and had a great view. If people come here on business looking for characterless, plain chain hotels, then they should go to a Travelodge or somewhere like that.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Gusmc35
Reviews.Content: Was on business in the Uk recently and my company booked me in here simply because it was close to our offices. I spent 5 nights and in all that time the staff hardly aknowledged my presence, the hotel decor is dated and the rooms are the same, the bed was like a rock with springs digging into my back, the cold tap didn't work in the bathroom and the hot tap was boiling. I arrived back one evening and the power was off, the guy who opened the door simply opened it and walked away I had to ask what was happening with the power? He simply shrugged his shoulders and said he didn't know, incredible that the hotel would employ a guy like this, he must own the dump.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Jane_StuartPuttnam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a room whilst on business. The location was excellent but that was about it. The room was a triple on the 4th floor with no fire exit apart from the ground floor. The beds were really hard, the curtains did not have enough fabric to close and it was freezing. When I rang reception at 1am to ask for a duvet or blanket I was told there wasn't any and to ring down in the morning. At 2am, the wind was howling. At 5am the alarm clock from the person before went off. Shower tray full of sewerage from drains A very poor excuse for a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Nickel40
Reviews.Content: It's so difficult to find good value hotels in London in convenient locations. This one is close to the Tube & buses & is in a quiet neighbourhood as well. Rooms are quirky, we had a smallish bedroom with a large dressing area adjacent. Bathroom was clean. Breakfast was fine. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not modern but full of character.”
Reviews.Author: Yogi357
Reviews.Content: I had passed this hotel 1000's of times as I grew up in the area, it seemed only natural to stay when visiting London to show my wife where I grew up and the sights. No frills, Victorian build with nice clean room, modern bathroom and friendly staff. We didnâ€™t use bar or dinning facilities (Â£7+ for continental breakfast, each, hmmm) but I can say we had a clean room and a comfortable stay. Some furniture was a little past its best but still very useable. Warm, quiet and full of character, with EXCELENT connections to central London, set in a quiet back street literally 2 minutes from Underground and busses. The â€˜superiorâ€™ room we were first offered was a twin with the beds together to make a â€˜king sizeâ€™, this I was not happy with as a king size is a king size not closed twins. This was remedied immediately and a room offered with a standard double (actually I was allowed to view two rooms and pick). The only other thing I didnâ€™t like was there was no fridge, but they never said there would be one, I just assumed, ohh and my wife said the pillows are too firm. Good sleeps and showers are the meat and drink of a days sightseeing, we had it all then and at a good price. All in all, a good stay and I would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming- clean, quaint and perfect”
Reviews.Author: CarrieAndy
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. Our room was on the top floor and was super clean, spacious, bright and sunny and made us feel like we were in an English Cottage. Clearly the building was old becasue the lifts were tiny and the hallways and doorways pretty narrow,(especially compared to the usual USA over sized new modern hotels) but heck that was what we liked. Our room was really nicely done (looked like it had been remodeled) and extremely comfy (we stayed 4 nights). Location was awesome for just hopping on the bus or tube or even a real nice walk to the green ways, zoo and some shopping. It didn't take much time to get to downtown via bus, and the stops were super close and easy to read. Staff was really helpful and very kind- we were in London during the tube strike, so we couldn't get taxi's to the airport for several hours- the staff really helped us stash our luggage so we could enjoy the city, and even when we arrived at 9am way before normal check-in Everything was great. One heads up though- somehow the plumbing was such that you got really hot water (the cold just didn't seem to come on), BUT if you call the desk they will tell you to simply open both the sink faucet and the tub/shower simultaneously - then the water regulated just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Older but nice Victorian-style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ondrej_Pavla
Reviews.Content: We had a nice clean room with a small bathroom. Breakfasts (English style) were amazing. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is not right in the city center but it is directly on the metro station and it is not that expensive as if it was in the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with free parking”
Reviews.Author: europair
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great position, just outside the congestion charging zone, but very close to Swiss Cottage tube station and only a few stops from the centre of London. It has a charming style although some areas are in need of a bit of a spruce up. Bedrooms were clean and comfortable and we slept very well. We drove from Germany and were delighted to get a free parking space at the hotel for the whole of our trip. There are, however, only three spaces available so it is really down to luck when you arrive. Our only complaint about this hotel is the attitude of the desk staff- they were all indifferent and looked pretty miserable. They helped when asked, but none of them knew how to smile or make their guests feel welcome or important. In contrast, the girls that served at breakfast were delightful and helpful. What a difference a smile makes! The breakfast was lovely. Just remember that if you want a cooked breakfast in addition to the continental one included in the price, you need to pay and get a voucher from reception before going down for breakfast. We didnâ€™t mind this at all, and felt that it was excellent value for just one pound extra.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for 1-2 days in London !”
Reviews.Author: Mims17
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Swiss Cottage is excellent for 1-2 or 3 days in London. Easy, 1 minute walk from the underground, restaurants after a few minutes walk near to the hotel, a good (english) breakfast , a nice bar for a glass before or after dinner, the only negative point is no terrace for sitting outside, if the weather is nice. We had a nice big triple room (402) on the 4th floor. No elevator from the 3rd to the 4th floor. The hotel is situated in a residential, safe and quiete area. We enjoyed our stay !

Reviews.Title: “What A Shame”
Reviews.Author: BarbieDollUSA
Reviews.Content: This hotel has much potential but our room - in the basement, while large, needed some work. Needed new mattresses, toilet kept running, etc... The staff at the reception, except for the director of sales, was totally brain dead! Ask them information or to do something was just too much effort for them. (This started the night we arrived, although desk person did point to us the direction where some restaurants might be open.) Asked if bar was open; was an extremely big bother for desk person to call someone for a drink. Someone eventually showed up. Ask if we could open patio doors since it was very warm - received a grunt in reply! Found out HEAT WAS ON asked desk personnel if he could turn it off - said he had to wait until Monday for someone to do it . (This was on a Sunday.) Maybe they would get more people to sit in their beautiful bar area if you weren't sweating your --- off! Hotel was kept very clean. Location was great and for the most part very quiet. I would think twice about sending my clients there (I am a travel agency owner.) just because of attitude of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Haz19
Reviews.Content: Best Western Swiss Cottage is a great hotel for a couple of days in London. It's right next to the tube station (Jubilee line), but far away enough that you don't get the rumblings of the tube, and far away enough from the main street to not hear the traffic. The hotel is very charming inside and the staff are really friendly. A lot of the reviews on here have complained about the halls but I think the layout of the hotel is very charming! The size of the room was really good, clean and airy. Free television with lots of channels, free wi-fi and tea and coffee in the room as well! While my partner went to a gig, I felt very safe in the hotel. Would definitely go again for the value, location and service provided. Thank you Swiss Cottage for a great couple of days!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for london”
Reviews.Author: barbara_mountjoy
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel for travelling around London as it's near the tube and bus stops, although we had a problem when the Jubilee line was closed one weekend for maintenance. The rooms ar a good size and wellpresented. There was a good choice for breakfast, but you had to pay extra.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: MichaelB16
Reviews.Content: The hotel structure is a bit odd, but not unpleasant. The room we got (304) was a family room for 4 people, so it was huge - a very pleasant surprise. Even tough we ordered a superior room, it was much more than we accepted. The continental breakfast was a pure and the variety of the food served was very little, but it was sufficient. The hotel staff was very correct but not too friendly. The location is excellent!! the tube is not more than a 100 meters away and all the good of Finchley road (shops, fast foods, restaurants, shopping center with multiplex cinema, supermarkets and much more) is at a few minutes walk. All in all we had a very nice stay at this hotel and we'll definitely come back again in future visits to London.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it considering the price of London hotels”
Reviews.Author: wheretoonextOntario
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here while in town for a wedding. It was exactly what I thought it would be. Clean, well located and affordable. The room was large and bright. Very quiet neighbourhood. Tube station was 2 min away. 15 min ride to central London. The overall decor is a little tired and the beds are firm with some springs poking. The bath room was always cleaned well and the room made up well each day. I was okay with the lack of updatedness, I figure if or once they do a total refirb the price will jump as well. Travelers with disabilities should avoid the 4th floor (where we were) as the tiny lift only goes to the 3rd then a flight of steep stairs. The largest rooms are on the 4th, we booked a Superior double (actually were given a triple, 3 single beds). The breakfast was priced high and I took the prior reviewers advice and ate elsewhere (Oliver's on Belsize was awesome!) All in all we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: allwrite
Reviews.Content: Surly reception staff on our arrival, triumphantly telling us (without checking) that the car park was full, very tired bedroom (wallpaper damaged, etc.), walls in lift badly defaced and simply left that way, rabbit-warren-like access to rooms, the list just goes on. Also ( no fault of the hotel) very difficult to locate and access by car and, as above, no daytime parking, Finally, when you find the breakfast room in the basement you're told you need to go back to reception to get a voucher for breakfast (?????). An unpleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and very well located”
Reviews.Author: birarang
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a superb location - almost next door to Swiss Cottage tube station and the shops and cafes of Finchley Road, but in a pretty, very quiet neighbourhood. We chose this hotel because we drove to London but wanted to avoid the central congestion charges - if you get there at the right time, there's a very limited amount of onsite parking (but also metered parking and an NCP carpark nearby). The hotel itself is pleasant enough - the decor and furniture are a little old and the basement ('ground floor') corridor is dank and musty, but the rooms are clean and comfortable. We paid a little extra for a superior double room, which was very spacious and had its own little seating area next to a set of doors which opened out onto...the carpark. Not the nicest view, but we weren't exactly there for the scenery! The bathroom was largeish and spotlessly clean, with a good shower and nice toiletries, though the floor was covered a strange greasy film - probably the remnants of their cleaning fluid (!). We only stayed for a night, so didn't really meet the staff - the ones we did encounter were polite in a rather distant manner. All in, this is a good choice if you want to be close to central London but in a tranquil, interesting neighbourhood with (some) parking. The Best Western website seems to offer the best online rates.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly The Ritz .... but OK”
Reviews.Author: kittynoodle
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a really cheap deal for this hotel, and were staying for a long weekend - my husband and I in one room, my mother and young daughter in another room. The hotel is in a great location, nice area and a stone's throw from Swiss Cottage tube. The hotel looked promising from the outside, and the reception area was lovely. Our rooms however were not too fabulous. They were down in the basement, in an area that was being refurbished (possibly this is why the rooms were so cheap). The rooms themselves were clean and the bathroom spotless - all towels and bedding lovely and clean too. The beds were possibly the hardest I have ever had the misfortune to sleep in though, the matress could have been made out of concrete. The beds in the other room were just as uncomfortable. Out bathroom was very small, and if you were a person of large build I can't see how you would manage to go to the toilet, so close was it to the opposite wall. The shower was terrible - the controls didn't work so it was by pure fluke that I got it to work at all. I couldn't manage to get the water hot so had to make do with a luke warm shower. The shower produced the most feeble trickle of water, and was about as powerful as a sprinkle of rain. Our toilet flush stopped working, and despite telling the staff at reception about it nothing whatsoever was done (we were told it took 15 minutes for the cistern to refill - ours didn't flush for around 24 hours!). Despite this, for the money we spent I don't feel too badly done by. It wasn't fantastic, but it wasn't terrible by a long shot. It's fine if you get a good deal and aren't too fussy! (tip: don't buy your breakfast there - there are several cafes on the main street a lot cheaper!)

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: designative
Reviews.Content: It's not the best hotel of my life, but it's not the worst. It's not close to city center, but conveniently close to Swiss cottage Station (gray line). if you wanna experience a " Londoner neighborhood, it's a good experience. Rooms: small, old furniture, but clean and a renovated bathroom- although the time we spent there, there was a leaking on the toilet...such a waste of water and they didn't fixed it... Breakfast: we didn't find anything close, they have a average~ good continental bkf, and you can pay a bit more to have eggs, bacon and beans, I think. Service: we were well treated. Free Internet: I would prefer to pay to have one...doesn' t work. If your budget is around USD 100, stay in this place. You gonna have a quiet room, a clean bathroom only for you and close to a subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent- - Is That a Ghost?”
Reviews.Author: REAL_CONTESSA
Reviews.Content: The Swiss Cottage hasnâ€™t changed much in years, I guess thatâ€™s ok then as long as youâ€™re not expecting mod cons (but wifi is available!) Narrow halls, tiny lift (when it works), creaky floorboards, mismatched Victorian-like furnishings, itâ€™s all part of the charm. My room was FABULOUS, on the first floor, large living room area with 3-sided bay windows overlooking the street, remodeled bathroom (very nice job), king size bed with clean linens and 4 big pillows. I booked directly with the hotel via email, I told them what size room I wanted and they did me a much better price than the web site. ONE CAVIET: if you book a taxi with the front desk, make sure you specify a black London taxi, otherwise youâ€™ll be hiring a mini-cab/private car at twice the regular fare - I learned the hard way. I added some photos and the ghost in the room was quiet and respectful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for London - lovely lobby”
Reviews.Author: theeternaltourist
Reviews.Content: I was tired of staying in the usual anonymous Holiday Inn and therefore chose this hotel. The area is great - close to the restaurants at 'the village' and with buses and the tube station almost in front of the door. Liked the hotel, especially the lobby with the piano, the couches and chairs. Everything looks like it has been recently fully refurbished so nothing to complain in terms of cleanliness. Had varying experience with staff - Overall very nice and attentive, but there was one guy at reception who totally ignored me when I arrived for check-in (although there was nobody else and he wasn't busy) and wasn't friendly at all. Free Wi-fi in every room, would definitely stay there again next time. I've had horrible experiences with hotels in London, and this was a very pleasant surprise for great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “NEEDS A REFURBISHMENT ASAP - A TIERD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: crimecrackers
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a good location for central London as the tube station is 2mins away, the area is residential and no noise at all so a good nights sleep you should receive. First impressions is the Reception / Lounge are very nice and good deco were they want to impress with antiques to a baby grand piano in the lounge area and access to the Internet if you forget your own gagets. The rooms I requested was a low floor as I do have walking difficulties and they put me on the third telling me there is a lift .... only goes to the third floor and my room was not near to the lift at all, not impressed. The room was a twin no.303 and I was travelling with a young child so you can imagine my horror when we entered and I looked to open the window there was no child locks and a sheer drop three floors down, I did ask to be moved but the hotel was full not a good start ..... The room itself was clean but the deco was grubby and needs a refurbishment asap, the shower adapter was stuck and the toilet was cracked, also a nail was not hammered down near to the door of the bathroom, good job we had shoes on. Food we did order Breakfast a cooked one and had to pay extra for this Â£6.75 this was over cooked and the sausage looked like they were from the day before along with the beans. Healthy option breakfast was poor also not a lot of variety with cheap makes of food a lot more could be done with this service I suggest you go out as you will enjoy your meal somewere else. The staff are very nice and friendly and could not be more helpful in giving direction and ringing taxis for guests.This Hotel would benefit from a full refurbishment of rooms and bringing the standard of food up to an acceptable level as the location is lovely and the Hotel could do a lot more to maximise its full potential. Disabled guests please check that you get a low room and parents with children younger ones watch the windows as they are ' Health Safety issues' a sheer drop with three functional windows to open is an accident waiting to happen. I did point out all the above to Manaement and was told to write all the above on the comments sheet ..... which I did oblige them with. Would like to see the Hotel after a refurbishment as the location is good for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ticks all boxes”
Reviews.Author: JLCPW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four nights with Breakfast. We found the hotel easily by car and, although there are only 3 parking spaces, spaces were available throughout our stay as many guests were holidaymakers from abroad. The room was clean and comfortable, with sheets and towels changed daily. All staff were pleasant and helpful and the Breakfast staff always had smiles. Literally one minute from Hampstead Theatre and Swiss Cottage Tube Station, which gets you in to central London in 10-15 mins. Although not much to see in Swiss Cottage high street (the Swiss Cottage pub is not to everyone's liking), it has all the basic stores e.g. M&S, Boots, WHSmiths etc for convenience. The hotel itself is set-back from the high street in a quiet residential area, a quiet 15 minutes walk to Belsize Park and Hampstead Heath. We would definitely stay here again because of the value for money you get when compared to central London hotels, especially as they give discount to local government/public sector workers. We walked to Abbey Road Studio from the hotel in 15 minutes, for a photo opportunity on the famous pedestrian crossing outside!

Reviews.Title: “A tired hotel with acceptable but modestly trained staff”
Reviews.Author: NickHIFU
Reviews.Content: OK if you get a good price. Good location for Swiss Cottage and Finchley Road but very tired inside with grubby feel

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jayshah51
Reviews.Content: I used to stay in this hotel for many years but it seems the service is getting worse and the rooms are getting too noicy as the walls are quite thin even though it is in a quite area. It gets very pricy. I had a confirmation in wirting that I will have the supirior double room but was given a standered double room. They chrge seperately for breakfast. It is better to go out and have your breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A nice, inexpensive hotel, close to everything, yet in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: ice-bjorn
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to London frequently over the past few years and have come to expect London hotels to be a good 1-2 stars overrated. Typically mid-range hotels have small rooms and attention to cleanliness and details is spotty at best. This hotel was a pleasant surprise; funky, with creaky floors and older rooms, yet, it has a certain charm helped by the building style and very quiet location. Service could be a little friendlier; if I ran a hotel, I'd probably greet new guests at check in. All it takes is a "welcome" or acknowledgment of arrival... In sum, if you're looking for perfection, this is not the place. However, if you can handle some Brit quaintness in an excellent location while you save money, this may very well be one of the best deals.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: JaneandBobby
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel and I would definitely go back when I am next in London.We had a superior double room that was very spacious, clean and comfortable. Staff very pleasant and an excellent english breakfast.The underground is about a two minute walk away so very convenient for getting into the centre of London.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay!”
Reviews.Author: MsJetSet88
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks great on the website, but only the lobby area has been refurbished. As I made my way upstairs, I started noticing how old everything looked, and when I opened my room door, I was so dissapointed..extremely old, kettle had mildew in it, everything felt dirty, heating wasnt powerful and the shower was only lukewarm. Breakfast is totally not worth it either. Whilst the location was great, I would not stay there again...really a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Beh007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel back in 2007 and frankly were quite disappointed. The 2* rating by Tripadvisor is pretty accurate, although from some of the ratings and the pictures at the time, we were expecting a 3*+. There is nothing really good to write about this hotel other than the fact that it offers parking, which is hard to come by in central London. It has a very small parking lot and overall it's a very difficult place to find if you're driving. We stayed there at the end of an England driving tour and did not want to get rid of our car, pay drop-off fees and get an expensive taxi to the airport and the parking option moved this hotel to the top of our list. If we were to do it again, we'd stay in London longer, ditch the car and pick another hotel, even if it costs $100/night more.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Scousepeasant
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel for a cheap rate on hotwire ($90 including taxes and fees). I was a little disappointed to find it was in Swiss Cottage, but it's almost next to the Underground making it really handy for central London. My room was large (by London standards) with a full bath (as opposed to shower) and tea and coffee making facilities. The staff was helpful but kept a low profile. I didn't eat here so can't comment on breakfast. There was a sign in the room saying that internet was available (presumably at a price) but I checked in and was going straight out again so didn't need to investigate this. The local area has a few shops and eating places, though I struggled to find a coffee before 7 a.m. but the tube is so handy that you can be in the centre quickly and if you're feeling energetic you can walk there across Regents Park which is close by. I'd stay here again for a trip of 1-2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convenient”
Reviews.Author: towntraveller
Reviews.Content: We had hoped to stay at a Best Western west end hotel using Nectar Points but were told when we tried to book through Nectar in October that it was "too near Christmas" to be able to use them! Instead we were offered a superior double room deal at the Swiss Cottage Hotel and I requested a quiet room. The room we were initially offered was in the basement, reeked of cigarette smoke and was facing on to the road. Somewhat reluctantly we were then shown a quiet, non-smoking second floor room which was comfortable with a good-sized bathroom, including a bath. It was in good decorative order and everything worked. Breakfast was adequate but the cooked breakfast was virtually cold. The hotel was being redecorated while we were there but this was well contained and did not affect us in any way. Staff were polite but not over-friendly. We would stay there again. It offered good value for money for London, it's near the Tube (which wasn't working the weekend we were there, but the replacement bus service was very good) and it's in a pleasant area not too far away from the west end.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like granma's house”
Reviews.Author: MOrario
Reviews.Content: The place was average. It had a very old-timey feel to it. I felt like I was entering a retirement home or something. The room was clean, I enjoyed the little tea/coffee they had set up for us and the bathroom was very spacious. I listened to my instincts and decided not to have breakfast there. I'm glad I didn't. This hotel is located in a residential area. Its 2 min walk to the subway. The staff was friendly and very helpful. I guess I would stay here again...when I'm 50.

Reviews.Title: “Almost good”
Reviews.Author: stevemacAshbourne
Reviews.Content: First impressions it looks a ok hotel.But it's a little tired looking and rooms are ok but not worth the money.The decor is in need of a refurbishment.The breakfast was ok.The positon of the hotel is good and it's not too noisy. Overall the web-site photos paint a better picture. I suppose that the hotel feels it can charge these prices because they are in London.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: debrac_8
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to start with this but don't stay here. Filthy rooms and the bedding was changed twice Threadbare Towels Paint and paper peeling off walls Hairs in the bed Hairs in the shower Boxes outside the windows Rotten window frames Door didn't close properly Had to check out at 10pm and move to another hotel as it was so awful Find somewhere else at all times

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: CarlaSuz
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for the traditional American hotel chain experience (i.e. vending/ice machines in hallways or every room identical to each other whether you're in L.A. or Sarasota) then this little hotel isn't for you. I found the hotel quaint and quirky, filled with antiques and pretty - if a bit odd- pieces of art. Narrow hallways that twist and turn and no 2 rooms alike. My room was on the 2nd floor with a beautiful view from the window. I had a full bathroom with tub (a nice soaking tub at that) and large, oversized windows on 3 walls. Beds were firm, room was clean, staff was gracious and helpful. Shower was of the european variety but water pressure was fine and despite showering at various times of the day, I never had a shortage of hot water. Wonderful, thick, heavy towels. (You do have to request face cloths however) Breakfast was good but not remarkable. (There are better breakfast options nearby on Finchly Road.) But I was able to get a great cup of coffee. There is a hot pot with instant coffee , tea and cocoa in the room if you prefer. Tube station is only 1 block away. Wednesdays and Fridays there's a farmers market right outside the door and down maybe 100 feet. Neighborhood is lovely, rather upscale and mostly residential. I will definitely go back on my next visit to London. A fantastic bargain for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: TillyAnnCheshire
Reviews.Content: On arrival the man at reception was very pleasant and gave us the key to a room which was exactly as I had requested, 3rd floor, twin room, non smoking and quiet. The interior design and furniture are what I would call "quaint and quirky". The room was very clean, airy and had a huge bathroom which was spotless, as was the bed linen. We had a very enjoyable evening and rounded it off with a nightcap in the bar. The room rate was reasonable for London and the location is ideal for the tube and at the same time on a very nice road. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ChloeNorfolk
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel to sightsee and attend concert. We paid Â£98 for room and additional Â£7.95 each for cooked breakfast. I was asked to pay on arrival as I had a debit card and not a credit card - I had not been told that before. Our room was downstairs along a corridor past rooms labeled 'smoking rooms'!! Our room was small and dark. It had large dark furniture and there was a large hedge outside the window that blocked the light. There was tea/coffee but no biscuits. We had lukewarm showers. The bedside lamp did not work. The bed was OK. The shower was still cold the next morning and we could not face it. The breakfast was surprisingly OK and it was worth the extra Â£1 for a cooked rather than continental breakfast. We did not complain about the shower or lamp as we did not have time. Overall we thought our room was poor value for money. The location was good as it was in a quiet area near a tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to tube line”
Reviews.Author: martyj49
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are Ok, the beds are a little soft, try and stay on main floor not basement rooms. We had room on main floor # 111 lots of windows space with 12-14 foot ceilings, and the main window opens for fresh air. Very close to tube line to central London, lots of shops and pubs within easy walking distance. Staff are friendly and helpful, breakfast the normal coffee/tea cereal toast jam etc. 6.95 pounds about standard for the UK. Would stay again Martyn & Lauren Jones

Reviews.Title: “So much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: jennifertesh
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here, I was a little nervous, but this hotel was really nice! PROS: good location- not right in the middle of the city, but in a safe and pretty area; the room itself was super cute, and had a nice view; at the end of the street/within a 2 minute walk there is a tube station, a pub, 3 fast food restaurants, 2 convenience stores, and a movie theater; staff was really friendly; and security was pretty good- you have to buzz to get in at night. CONS: there are only 2 that I can think of- no air conditioning, and a teeny tiny bathroom with a teeny tiny shower. It's not the Ritz, but overall I was very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Bad manners, boorish behavior”
Reviews.Author: GoodPlanet
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay an extra couple of nights in London and looked to Expedia.com for a good rate on a reputable hotel. Although the price was significantly higher than we had paid for 3 and 4 star rooms for the previous week, we thought the property looked quite nice and worth a try. We were sadly mistaken. When we arrived at the hotel, the front desk clerk (manager, I believe) reluctantly tore himself away from his conversation with an employee, then couldn't find our reservation, and asked how we had booked. We told him "Expedia" and he rolled his eyes, told his assistant to immediately call and close all "discount" bookings, and proceeded to give us the "Basil Fawlty" treatment. Without any pretense at good manners or effort to welcome us to his property, he gave us the key to a "discount" room up in the attic, and turned his back on us. Up in the attic, we found a clean, fairly well presented "British style" room that had been recently renovated. It would never win any prizes for tasteful decorating, but at least it was clean, safe and secure. The only real faults with the room itself were poor water pressure and the fact that the hot water tap dispensed hot water and the cold water tap dispensed even hotter water. The bed springs were creaky and the TV reception was poor. But in an English 2-star hotel you learn to be forgiving, and overlook such deficiencies as "charm" or "character" :-) At checkout time I received further attitude from a clerk when he was forced to accept a credit card instead of cash for my WiFi usage. You'd think that three pounds per hour for WiFi would be a great source of hotel income (usually offered for free in most reputable hotels), but at the Swiss Cottage Best Western the taking of money was just another excuse for eye rolling and bad manners. I'm a well dressed, very polite and respectable guy. The one thing I do expect from any establishment where I spend hundreds of dollars and/or pounds is appreciation of my business. A simple "welcome", a smile, or even a simle "thank you" go a long way. Thanks for nothing Best Western, you can be sure I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected based on previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: prycehudson
Reviews.Content: What made this such a good hotel was the short walk to the tube and the safe location. We did not opt for the breakfast but found a little french bistro up the street that served a wonderful breakfast for the same amount we would have been charged for the continental. There are plenty of restaurants in the area if you like ethnic food (which we do!) The rooms were fine, spacious and clean. The plumbing is what I expect for a European hotel. The service is good but if you require hand and foot service, this is definitely not the hotel for you. And if you can manage London's underground (Jubilee line to most major attractions), you've got a great bargain (off season) and a great hotel! If you are looking for something clean, safe, comfortable and recognize you are still in a large cosmopolitan city and exercise some simple safety concerns, I would recommend this place. The only issues I had was the guest in the upstairs room left the bloody shower on our last night there and we had to change rooms in the middle of the night (night staff was efficient for a room change). Also, make sure you check your room carefully upon checkout because if you have left something, they aren't very responsive and chances are... it won't be 'found' or returned.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Swiss Cottage was OK”
Reviews.Author: fcpsretired
Reviews.Content: We just finished an eleven night stay at this hotel. On the whole it was very satisfactory. It was clean and well carried for. We had a superior twin with Continental breakfast for Â£90.00. That took some negotiating on the phone direct. Being winter and the low season helped. The breakfast was adequate but without variety. Cold cereal, 4 kinds, juice, italian salami, processed cheese slices, rolls and occasionally crousants [sp] tea or coffee and white or brown toast. For $10.00/person they could do better. Location in zone 2 was fine because it is 1 1/2 blocks from the Swiss Cottage tube stop on the Jubilee line which is frequent and very fast. Further, it is not as crowded as the Piccadilly line or the Victoria. Whines: The front desk staff was not terribly co-operative at times. The sound on my TV got locked at a low level and I was told that they were all that way. That was on Friday. On Monday when I went to the front desk to complain again, the clerk sent someone up right away and it was unlocked. When I checked I was told that the reservation was without breakfast. I insisted that it included a full English breakfast. My husband had talked to the desk manager or someone on Monday and arranged it. He reluctantly looked up the reservation and found the note but said it was continental breakfast. I was too tired to argue the point. As it turned out the English breakfast was the same as the continental with the addition of cooked eggs, hash browns, bacon or sausage, beans and tomato. We did not need that much food so it worked out. But the clerk's attitude was surly at best. When we asked about a church for Mass same clerk had no idea but found a card with one on it, but then gave total incorrect directions. When we asked if there was a launderette near by, he thought there was one at the end of Eton St. Well that was a mile down the road. Basically it is poor front desk training and supervision. On the plus side, I did not have to wait until 2 pm to get into our room. I was it by 11:30am, for which I was grateful. On the whole it was a positive experience if one ignored the front desk staff. We would go back

Reviews.Title: “Nice and charming”
Reviews.Author: herbina
Reviews.Content: Swiss Cottage was a positive experience for our stay in london. I stayed there with my friend for 2 nights and felt that it was definitely worth the money considering the high prices of London hotels. The room was tidy and spacious. The beds were quite hard but that didn't bother me. I really liked the hotel's Victorian athmosphere. The neighborhood was really quiet and nice and the underground station just a few hundred meters away. The hotel floors were a bit squeaky but it only woke me up once when the neighbours came back in the night. The breakfast was ok, the normal boring stuff but sufficient for giving the energy for sightseeing for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “once more a challenge!”
Reviews.Author: rosstucker
Reviews.Content: Every year we say that we can't face the inconvenience of staying here -- but we go back! There's a seedy charm about the place; the rooms are big; the breakfast is pretty good; the area is quiet and convenient to the underground. We like the area particularly -- it's away from "tourist London" -- and there's a feeling of living in the Hampstead area. So we'll keep going to the Swiss Cottage, I guess -- as long as it survives...

Reviews.Title: “Beware of hooded thieves in the night”
Reviews.Author: diverdeb
Reviews.Content: The room we had was a decent room on the first floor (2nd floor european). It was very warm, so we opened the window - latching it so it was open about 4". At 3:30am, I was awoken by a noise and light. I opened my eyes to see a dark, hooded person standing in our room. I screamed as did my husband and he fled back out of the room through the window and down the fire escape. We called the front desk and they stated they would call the police. When we checked out, the clerk claimed they had never had this type of problem before, but the criminal must have seen the open window and took advantage of an opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but hotel only OK”
Reviews.Author: Business_traveller50
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business which was nearby. The price is good for the area but the rooms I saw were not very good. The bathroom widow in the first room offered did not close. The second was OK but very small. The electrical wiring seemed odd with switches turning on lights in other rooms !! Bizarre. On the plus side the underground station is very close and there is a good selection of cafes and resaurants nearby.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Swiss Cottage Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 4 Adamson Rd | Swiss Cottage, London NW3 3HP, England
